pros: Perception programs is a great agency that truly cares about the individuals that are served. I personally needed to work for a company that I believed was doing meaningful work and I have found that at PPI. I have supportive supervisors that are able to give me feedback because they believe in my potential.
cons: The work can be stressful, however that is inherent in the human service field

pros: Great place to start a career in social services
cons: Limited training was given during onboarding

review_title: As always, good with the bad
pros: Perception Programs provides the most time off between holidays, personal days, sick days and vacation days I've ever seen. They go out of their way to accommodate staff with time off. The clinical and administrative staff go out of their way to help people. The atmosphere is, in general, laid back.
cons: Perception Programs does not provide raises, cost of living increases or merit salary increases. There are no opportunities to advance within the company. Facilities are poorly maintained. Staff is not treated equally.

pros:
Ethically driven non-profit with a strong management team. 
Good benefits for full time workers - 3 weeks sick & 3 weeks vacation. 10 holiday, 2.5 personal days.
New CEO has a lot of energy and is person / client orientated.
cons:
Company does not have many advancement opportunities for non-LCSW personnel. 
No education benefits.

pros: Diverse clientele, easy to obtain needed resume building experience.
cons: Minimal training,  mismanaged programs, negative culture minimal support of development.
